duties_responsibilities.duty: Initiate, execute, and complete complex, highly visible multimodal pedestrian projects and programs.
Manage the Pedestrian Master Plan New Sidewalks program and prioritize critical pedestrian safety improvements.
Participate in the development and implementation of new pedestrian improvement policies and provide staff support to the Pedestrian Advisory Board.
Lead community outreach efforts to identify pedestrian realm deficiencies and develop plans to address concerns.
Collect and analyze traffic data, including traffic volumes and speeds, pedestrian counts, and collision history.
Participate in consultant selection processes and negotiate scopes of work.
Prepare and present information about projects to community groups, government agencies, and other stakeholders.
Respond to stakeholder and citizen inquiries, explaining policies and/or investigating issues.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's Degree in engineering, transportation planning, urban planning, or related field
